required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Head and Shoulder Positioning on the Cross-sectional Area of the Subclavian Vein in Obese Adults
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Head and Shoulder Positioning on the Cross-sectional Area and Location of the Subclavian Vein in Obese Adults

brief_summary.textblock: In the present study, the cross-sectional area of subclavian vein, the distances of subclavian vein ~ subclavian artery and subclavian vein ~ pleura are assessed in different head positions (neutral, rotation to ipsilateral or contralateral sides) and different shoulder positions (neutral or lowered) in spontaneous breathing obese adults.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through the completion of assessment, an average of 1 hr
primary_outcome.description: Cross-sectional area of subclavian vein is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depth of subclavian vein from skin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the completion of assessment, an average of 1 hr
secondary_outcome.description: Depth of subclavian vein from skin is assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distance of subclavian vein ~ subclavian artery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the completion of assessment, an average of 1 hr
secondary_outcome.description: Distance between subclavian vein and subclavian artery is assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through the completion of assessment, an average of 1 hr
secondary_outcome.description: Distance between subclavian vein and pleura is assessed.

intervention.description: Subclavian vein and related structures are examined using ultrasonography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy obese adults (BMI ≥ 30)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medication affecting vascular elasticity History of central venous catheterization or clavicle fracture History of lung surgery, operation of chest cage
